meaning_story: A tree crab breaks into your games cabinet and steals a chess piece. He’s trying to impress all his tree crabs back home by showing how not afraid of humans he is. Plus the rest of the tree crabs need one last chess piece to complete their set.
meaning_hint: Imagine finding this tree crab in your games cabinet trying to make off with your chess piece. This tree crab is big and you weren’t expecting to find it in your games cabinet so you’re kind of terrified. You scream in horror.
reading_story: Before the tree crab can make it out with the chess piece, you shut the door to the games cabinet and lock it with a key き, trapping the tree crab inside. Now what?
reading_hint: You put the key in your pocket and call animal control. They unlock the cabinet with the key and remove the tree crab from your home. But who’s to say he won’t be back??

meaning_story: What you say to a nurse he will soon defer to the doctor. He isn't going to treat you himself, sure he'll do a few things, but then he'll defer all of that to your real doctor. The person who's REALLY going to help you.
meaning_hint: Imagine your nurse deferring to your doctor. He wasn't going to treat you at all. Why even have nurses?
reading_story: The nurse defers you to your doctor... Joseph (じょう) Stalin! No! Nurse come back! I'm sorry about what I said. You defer to the doctor because you have to, but not today okay? Please Joseph, please defer back to the nurse!
reading_hint: Imagine your despair when your nurse defers all your care over to Joseph Stalin.

meaning_story: Standing in the door is a turkey wanting you to employ him. This turkey needs a job. He needs you to employ him. He’s gonna stand in your door until you give him a job.
meaning_hint: Will you employ this turkey? Look at him. He’s very sad and poor. The turkey standing in your door really needs you to employ him.
reading_story: You decide to employ this turkey to take care of your 子. Your 子 doesn’t like human babysitters, so you employ this turkey to babysit your 子.
reading_hint: Imagine your 子 and the turkey playing together. Your 子 looks very happy. You made the right choice.

meaning_story: The excuse radical and the excuse kanji are exactly the same! Dandy!
reading_story: Who always makes excuse after excuse? Men めん! They have an excuse for everything. Why didn’t you take out the trash? Why did you forget my birthday? It’s just excuse after excuse with men. So I’ve heard, anyway.
reading_hint: Imagine all the men you’ve talked to in your life. Think of every excuse they’ve told you. Think of the worst excuse you’ve ever heard. Remember that.

meaning_story: Your buddy the sheep is part of a flock. A flock of sheep. Your sheep buddy is a member of a flock.
meaning_hint: Imagine following your sheep buddy back to his flock. Feel the soft fur of all the sheep around you as they baa peacefully.
reading_story: Now take out your gun ぐん and murder every sheep in the flock. Except for your buddy. You’re incredibly jealous of your buddy and you don’t like the attention his flock gives him so that’s why you decided to murder them all with a gun.
reading_hint: Feel the recoil or the gun in your hands and the ringing of the shots in your ears as you slaughter the flock without remorse. BANG BANG BANG!

meaning_story: In a tree on nine branches are some cross frames. Each cross frame is hung on the branches of the tree. You don’t know who decided to hang the frames there, but you think it might be some new wave art or something. Actually you need a frame, and there are already nine up there, so you decide to take one.
meaning_hint: Feel the tree bark under your palms as you climb up the tree to take a frame. You get a splinter from grabbing the frame. It really smarts.
reading_story: The cross shaped frame you took has a picture of the American rapper Waka (わく) Flocka in it. If you don’t know who Waka is, take the time to YouTube a song of his to get the Waka beat flowin’ through your body.
reading_hint: Look at the picture of Waka Flocka as you imagine the sound of his groovy tunes. It almost makes you forget how painful that frame splinter you got is. Almost.

meaning_story: In front of you is a gold outhouse. It smells like old feces, but it's so beautiful and shiny. You open the door and look inside. Sitting on the toilet seat, and the only thing that isn't made of gold, is a gun.
meaning_hint: Go ahead and pick it up. Smell the rank smell. Focus on how different the gun is from everything inside the outhouse, which looks like it was dipped in gold, inside and out. The building itself is a stark contrast to the surrounding area.
reading_story: Suddenly, the door to the outhouse flies open, and someone grabs the gun out of your hands. "Hey!" says a Jewish (じゅう) Rabbi. "I have to use the bathroom!" He sits on the toilet and starts shooting at squirrels from the open doored golden outhouse.
reading_hint: You could also imagine the Jewish Rabbi shooting at you, too, while he sits upon his special seat.

meaning_story: A leader who lives in a mountain is a hermit. The only thing this hermit is a leader of now is mountain goats. This hermit dislikes people so that’s why he lives in a mountain now.
meaning_hint: Imagine this odd hermit leading mountain goats around the mountain, marching to the beat of a drum. It’s a strange sight indeed.
reading_story: One day the hermit was leading the mountain goats around and he ran into a centaur せん. The centaur said that he was the rightful leader of these mountain goats so the centaur challenged the hermit to a duel.
reading_hint: Picture this old hermit fighting this centaur in a duel. Who do you think is gonna win? Hear the hermit screaming in agony as the centaur demolishes him.

meaning_story: You have three slides and a butcher in your home country. That’s it That’s all your home country is known for. Three slides and a butcher.
meaning_hint: Think back and reflect on your home country. There wasn’t much tourism, but you sure did enjoy sliding down all three slides and getting some meat from the butcher afterwards. Imagine the wind in your hair as you zoom down one of the slides and getting some meat to eat once you reach the bottom.
reading_story: You need to get some tourism traffic in your home country so you hire the great Hou-dini ほう to put on a show. Hou-dini will surely be famous enough to attract many many tourists here to your home country.
reading_hint: Imagine Hou-dini performing his magic show in your home country and hear the crowd get louder and louder as more and more people flood into your home country to see the great Hou-dini.

meaning_story: You loiter around with a gun while your friend tries to correct a stamp to make it more honorable. Someone messed with the stamp machine and your friend is trying to correct the error. You’re loitering around with a gun since you’re his bodyguard. To have an error on the stamp would not be honorable, so that’s why your friend is going to correct it.
meaning_hint: Feel the weight of the gun in your hands as your friend works to make the stamp honorable again. Listen to your friend complain about how there are so few people left in the world that are honorable. Also keep in mind that the correct radical is a little different with the vertical line going through the top, so just think of that as the error trying to be corrected.
reading_story: Just as you’re pondering what it means to be honorable, your friend gets shot. “Oh… oh no. They’ve got me. Go (ご)! Go and save yourself! Go, go, go!”
reading_hint: Hear your friend cries in pain, and yells “go” as he encourages you to save yourself. Is it honorable to save yourself and not help your friend? Probably not.

meaning_story: The fish stick reality is a tough one. You were once rich, but now the reality is that you can only afford fish sticks. You watch your rich friends eating their fancy things while you put fish sticks in your mouth. Such a feeling of humility washes over you.
meaning_hint: Focus on the humility feeling here. You have to feel like these fish sticks are a terrible thing, but the reality is you can't afford anything else (maybe your uncle runs a fish sticks factory and is giving you the rejects).
reading_story: What caused your great fall? Why are you in such a state of humility, watching the rich people from the ditches with your fish sticks? Well, you used to make all your money from your shin (しん), as you were the world's greatest shin model. Then, in a tragic soccer accident, you got a bruise, ruining your career forever.
reading_hint: Imagine through the series of events that got your shin bruised. It will never be silky smooth again. Such humility!

meaning_story: You use your foot to kick Wolverine in the face so a turkey can leap to freedom. This turkey is trying to escape from Wolverine by leaping over a fence. Wolverine doesn’t want the turkey to escape, but you kick him with your foot and the turkey is then free to leap to safety.
meaning_hint: Imagine kicking Wolverine in the head with your foot as the turkey makes turkey sounds in the background. He’s taller than you so you must leap as you kick.
reading_story: After you kick Wolverine and the turkey is safe, you leap onto a yak (やく) to make your getaway. This yak is really fast so you’ll have no problem outrunning Wolverine while riding it.
reading_hint: Leap! Leap onto the yak. Feel the yak fur beneath you as you ride away to safety, wind in your hair.

meaning_story: They say the Mona Lisa has no modesty. You know that portrait of the Mona Lisa? She’s not wearing pants in it because she has no modesty.
meaning_hint: Imagine the Mona Lisa running around without pants. How can anyone lack modesty as much as her? Hear her giggling maniacally as she runs around without pants.
reading_story: As the Mona Lisa runs around with no pants, proudly displaying her lack of modesty, Ken (けん) from Street Fighter starts chasing after her. Ken loves modesty in women, so he’s chasing the Mona Lisa around threatening her with hadokens until she puts some pants on.
reading_hint: Envision Ken chasing the pantless Mona Lisa around firing hadokens left and right. The Mona Lisa continues to giggle.

meaning_story: A drop of rain falls on a bear leaning up against a cross stuck into a mound. The drop wakes the bear up and he rolls down off the mound. After the bear rights himself, he assumes that the cross pushed him off the mound so he charges into the cross atop the mound and knocks it over.
meaning_hint: Imagine this whole scene. A drop of water rouses the bear and he becomes enraged after he rolls down the mound. Hear the bear roar with anger as he charges up the mound and violently smashes the cross into the ground.
reading_story: Once the bear fully wakes up he realizes that he just rolled down the mound on his own and the cross was not to blame. What a fool (ふ) this bear was. He knows it too. The bear feels pretty foolish.
reading_hint: Now look at the bear sitting atop the mound with his head in his paws, looking like a fool filled with regret. This bear feels like a fool for attacking the cross like he did.

meaning_story: The waiter is having a one sided conversation with himself. You hear the waiter mumbling so you listen in. It’s a one sided conversation. You only hear one side. Is the waiter insane?
meaning_hint: Listen to this one sided conversation the waiter is carrying out. Imagine what the waiter is saying and try to fill in the blanks in the one sided conversation you hear.
reading_story: While listening in on the one sided conversation of the waiter, you hear him mention something about a cutter かた. A cookie cutter. It sounds like the waiter is planning on using a cookie cutter to do something… sinister.
reading_hint: Since the conversation is only one sided, you’re not entirely sure what the waiter is planning on doing with this cookie cutter but it’s making you nervous. You finish your meal and pay your bill as soon as possible and never return to the restaurant again.

meaning_story: You want to start construction on a home for your geoduck, but first you must write a paragraph to the builders justifying the house. The construction workers don’t think your geoduck needs a home, but you aim to convince them otherwise with a well worded paragraph.
meaning_hint: Imagine what you would write in this paragraph to get the construction started on this geoduck house. You need to be convincing. Imagine writing a rough draft with a pencil and paper.
reading_story: You realize you need to step things up so you ask こういち to write the paragraph for you. こういち is a longtime lover of geoducks, so he is happy to write a convincing paragraph for you.
reading_hint: Imagine こういち writing a paragraph about geoducks. こういち looks very happy while he’s writing it. Perhaps, too happy…

meaning_story: It’s an injustice the way this doll is patterned. It’s patterned in such a way that it is extremely displeasing to the eye. What a hideous doll this is.
meaning_hint: Look at this ill patterned doll. Feel it in your hands as your stomach turns in absolute disgust.
reading_story: You can’t stand the injustice that this patterned doll is bringing you so you give it to your pet eagle (い) to tear apart. Your eagle loves to destroy things, especially when they are ill patterned.
reading_hint: Listen to your eagle screech loudly as it tears apart the patterned doll with its beak and claws. It’s incredibly violent.

meaning_story: A butcher enters the winter of life, and gains never-ending prosperity. The winter of life is a special season indeed. The winter of life comes once in a great while, and this butcher is now experiencing it and gaining all the prosperity.
meaning_hint: Imagine yourself getting so much prosperity from this winter of life. You're right there with the butcher. Hear him sharpening his butcher knives as you feel the chill of winter around you. Prosperity!
reading_story: You’re Ryu (りゅう) from Street Fighter and the reason you wanted to gain prosperity was for your fighting career. With your newfound prosperity you defeat Ken and Akuma. You are Ryu and you’re the best! Never-ending prosperity for Ryu forever and ever!
reading_hint: Imagine this prosperity you have as Ryu. Imagine yourself pummeling Ken and Akuma and all the other Street Fighters into the ground. All because you experienced the winter of life with your butcher friend.

meaning_story: Your mouth holds a scroll depicting the range of your tongue and teeth. Your circular mouth houses your tongue and teeth. They are contained within the range that is your mouth which is recorded in the scroll.
meaning_hint: Feel the inside of your mouth with your tongue. Such a wide range of sensations are contained here. And also a scroll.
reading_story: Ken (けん) from Street Fighter wants to increase the range of his mouth so he puts his mouth on yours. Basically, ken is French kissing you.
reading_hint: Imagine Ken from street fighter Frenching you. Feel his tongue as he thrusts it into your mouth and wiggles it around, exploring the range of your mouth. This is disgusting.

meaning_story: There’s an arrow in your turkey and you use your power as group leader to recommend that we don’t eat the turkey. There’s an arrow in this turkey. The arrow looks a little broken, so there’s probably splinters all up inside that turkey. I know you’re all hungry but I can’t recommend eating this bird.
meaning_hint: You can’t recommend this turkey. It’s probably dangerous. Imagine sending this turkey back in a restaurant, very upset with everything. Also keep in mind that the arrow is half buried in the turkey and looks a little broken since the arrow radical is a bit off.
reading_story: Instead of eating this arrow ridden turkey, you recommend we all eat turkey out of a can (かん). Turkey in a can is much safer. There’s no room for an arrow in a can of turkey, so that’s what you recommend we eat instead.
reading_hint: After you imagine yourself recommending we all eat turkey out of a can, take the cool metal can in your hands and picture yourself slopping down the canned turkey. Mmm, fresh.

meaning_story: Holding a nailbat, a giant makes his refusal. His refusal is to give you his nailbat. You asked for the giant’s nailbat but he doesn’t want to give it to you. Refusal sucks.
meaning_hint: Look at how awesome that nailbat is. You really want that giant nailbat. Too bad your request was met with refusal.
reading_story: Refusing to accept the giant’s refusal, you chase him through Little Kyoto (きょ) in an attempt to steal his bat. Imagine Little Kyoto getting destroyed as the giant runs into things and crushes buildings.
reading_hint: Hear the buildings exploding around you in Little Kyoto as you chase after that giant nailbat you want so badly. Is it worth all the destruction you’ve caused? Probably.

meaning_story: There’s a living pine needle in your cleat reminding you of your former life before you began to cultivate this rice plant. Before this rice plant, you were growing a pine tree and the still living pine needle in your cleat reminds you of your former life and where you came from. It’s important to remember the past.
meaning_hint: Feel the pine needle in your cleat as you water and feed your rice plant. Feel the pine needle poking your soft foot with each step. Ow, ow, ow.
reading_story: Soon you realize that the pine needle was just a figment of your imagination. “いないね” you say to yourself as you continue to tend to your rice plant. “いないね…”
reading_hint: いないね means that the pine needle you thought was in your shoe actually wasn’t there after all. Your former self has been haunting you through this phantom pine needle you created in your mind.

meaning_story: A big turkey has to measure a safe before he can rob it. If the safe is too big it won’t fit in his getaway van and the robbery will have been a failure. So before the turkey robs the place he needs to measure the safe.
meaning_hint: Imagine this turkey as he tries to rob this safe. See him with the tape measure as he determines whether or not the safe is too big.
reading_story: The safe that the turkey is trying to rob ends up being uber (うば) big. Like, really uber big. So uber big that the turkey can’t even measure it with his tape measure. There’s no way he’s gonna be able to rob this place.
reading_hint: Imagine the size of this uber big safe. What could be inside? Probably something good.

meaning_story: A gold hill is better than a steel one. Look at the gold hill. It’s more valuable and way better. Sure the steel hill is more sturdy, but who cares about that?
meaning_hint: Imagine being given the choice of which hill you want to own. Do you want to go with gold and riches, or steel stability? Hmm…
reading_story: Well it doesn’t matter because こういち just arrived and claimed the gold hill for himself. Now you’re stuck with the steel hill. こういち laid claim to the gold hill before you could make a decision.
reading_hint: Imagine こういち on the gold hill, heckling you for how poor your steel hill is in comparison. こういち can be pretty mean sometimes, huh?

meaning_story: The turtle shell radical and the turtle shell kanji are exactly the same! Cowabunga!
reading_story: Driving your car (か), you run over a turtle shell. Oh no! There was a turtle in the turtle shell. You’ve killed it!
reading_hint: Imagine the crunching of the turtle shell as you run it over with your car. That poor turtle in the turtle shell is now dead thanks to you.

meaning_story: There’s some propaganda in the grave you’re in, on the wall. There’s a big propaganda poster on the wall of your grave. It’s a propaganda poster about how heaven isn’t really all it’s cracked up to be.
meaning_hint: Look at the wall this propaganda poster is on. Feel the dirt wall with your hands as you read over the propaganda poster.
reading_story: While you touch the wall of your grave you feel something. You pull it out of the wall only to discover it’s a cob (かべ) of corn. Corn on the cob! How fortuitous. You are very hungry and corn on the cob is one of your favorite foods. Plus, you’re in a grave and going to be laid to rest soon, so this will be your last meal.
reading_hint: Lean up against the cool grave wall as you nibble away at your corn on the cob. Keep in mind that once you finish the cob, you’ll die and be put to rest in your grave forever.

meaning_story: A good pelican can stop you from having to go on welfare. And by this I mean that you can sell the pelican for a lot of money. To avoid having to go on welfare you need to find a prize pelican to sell for top dollar.
meaning_hint: You really don’t want to go on welfare. Think about how much you don’t want to go on welfare as you scour the surrounding area looking for a good pelican to steal.
reading_story: You remember that Charlie Sheen (し) is an avid collector of pelicans. This is your ticket out of welfare. You sneak into Charlie Sheen’s mansion and steal a pelican. He notices, and chases you out of the house.
reading_hint: As you’re running away from Charlie Sheen, imagine how nice it will be not having to worry about going on welfare anymore. Ah, life is good.

meaning_story: Every winter you are alert for danger. Everyone knows that the worst monsters come out in the winter so you need to be alert if you want to survive.
meaning_hint: Imagine yourself out in the winter wilderness. You hear twigs snapping, growling, leaves rustling. You’re incredibly alert and aware of everything going on around you.
reading_story: Being the alert fellow you are, you hear a sasquatch approaching and dive into a trash bin (びん) to hide. The bin smells really bad and you are keenly alert to all the various stenches and smells currently penetrating your nostrils, but at least you are safe.
reading_hint: Listen to the sasquatch rumble on by as you continue to smell the smelly smells of this putrid bin you’re in.

meaning_story: You attempt to expel wind out of your mouth but lack the breath to blow out any. You’re using your mouth and trying to blow out some air, but you are failing to do so.
meaning_hint: Blow some air out of your mouth. It’s easy, right? Imagine what could cause you to fail at this activity.
reading_story: You silly fool (ふ), the reason you couldn’t blow any air out of your mouth is because your hand was over it. You can’t blow air out that way. You silly fool, you.
reading_hint: Attempt to blow air out of your mouth while covering it with your hand. It’s hard to do, right? Only a fool would try to blow air out of their mouth this way.

meaning_story: It is time to do the mouth sun sun chant. Mouth! Sun sun, mouth! Sun sun! This chant you do with your mouth makes the sun rise. You’re very good at this chant.
meaning_hint: Let’s practice the chant some more, shall we? Mouth! Sun sun, mouth! Sun sun! Mouth, sun sun mouth! Sun sun!
reading_story: The reason you are doing this chant is because the shogun (しょう) wanted to see the sun. The sun just set, but the shogun wanted to see the sun for longer so he made you chant your chant to bring it back. Silly shogun. So greedy.
reading_hint: Now imagine the shogun doing the chant with you. He’s a quick learner. Mouth! Sun sun, mouth! Sun sun!

meaning_story: If you try to go somewhere but you're too heavy you'll collide with everything. Cars, people, houses. You're too heavy to dodge, so you collide with it all.
meaning_hint: Imaging being too heavy to go anywhere without colliding with things.
reading_story: You're going around the town, you collide with a bunch of things, when all of a sudden you collide with the shogun (しょう)! Oh no! The shogun looks really mad.
reading_hint: Imagine colliding with the shogun. Imagine his angry face. Imagine his fist colliding with your face.

meaning_story: A drunkard of twenty years of age thinks that a new commandment should be issued. “Thou shalt never be sober!” Since he’s a drunkard, this suggestion for a commandment makes sense, but only to him. He’s only twenty years old, after all.
meaning_hint: Imagine this twenty year old drunkard tottering around as he proclaims his new idea for a commandment. Thou shalt never be sober!
reading_story: The drunkard gets disoriented and wanders into the woods, shouting his new commandment at the top of his lungs. His yelling attracts a coyote (かい), and the coyote proceeds to attack and maul the drunkard to death. Looks like his commandment isn’t going to catch on.
reading_hint: Hear the drunkard screaming for help and mercy as the coyote disembowels him. Maybe his new commandment should have been “Thou shalt not go into a coyote infested forest and scream at the top of thine lungs.”

meaning_story: You examine the Mona Lisa and paint an exact replica concurrently. You’re a master forger of paintings, but you need to concurrently look at the painting you forge as you paint or else the forgery will be no good.
meaning_hint: Have you ever tried to draw something without actually looking where you’re drawing? Imagine doing this except with paints and copying the Mona Lisa. It’s pretty stressful.
reading_story: To make matters worse, while you are concurrently studying the Mona Lisa and painting your forgery, Ken (けん) from Street Fighter is concurrently dancing around the room doing hadokens and shoryukens as loud as he possibly can. Ken has no consideration at all.
reading_hint: With so many things going on concurrently, you start to go insane. While staring at the Mona Lisa, just listen to Ken continue to scream hadoken and shoryuken at the top of his lungs.

meaning_story: The flowers are being worked upon by a tsunami with a specialty for knowing how to dilute things. The tsunami can dilute the flowers by pouring itself onto it. A tsunami can dilute things because it is made of water. You could say that it’s its specialty.
meaning_hint: Look at the flowers as they begin to dilute. Their color and fragrance and dimensions become weaker and more spread out. It’s really trippy to witness.
reading_story: As you watch the flower dilute, you determine that this is obviously a nature hack (はく). You’ve never seen anything like this before, so you think the tsunami found out how to hack nature and that’s how it got so good at diluting things. By hacking nature.
reading_hint: As you continue to watch the flower dilute due to the water being poured onto it by the tsunami, imagine what techniques this tsunami is using to hack nature. Is the tsunami a super cyborg from the future? Maybe.

meaning_story: Out of the grave you pull a flag and then exit the ditch. Someone had dug a grave in this ditch and put a flag in there to mark it. You like the flag, so you climbed into the ditch and pulled it out.
meaning_hint: Imagine yourself climbing in and out of this ditch to take this flag from the grave. Feel the flag pole in your hand as you climb back out of the ditch onto flat ground again.
reading_story: As you climb out of the ditch, the flag bursts into flames! Holy (ほり) crap! This flag was booby trapped? Somebody really didn’t want it removed from the ditch. Holy moly.
reading_hint: Holy cow, man. That flag just blew up in your hands. Feel the heat and slight burn on your palms as you look back into the ditch you just crawled up out of.

meaning_story: You use stilts made of your own ribs to get your daily dose of exercise. It’s hard to walk in stilts especially if you have no ribs, so if you need a dose of exercise that is difficult but also fun, stilts are the way to go.
meaning_hint: Imagine walking around in these stilts. If you’re good at it you can cover a lot of ground. This dose of exercise is the best you’ve ever had. Feel the sweat running down your face as you parade around in your stilts. Feel the hole in your side.
reading_story: For an extra dose of challenge, you decide to play the xylophone (ざい) with your stilts. This is really hard. The xylophone is near the ground, so you have to hop on your stilts and be very quick to hit all the xylophone keys.
reading_hint: Hear the xylophone go plink plink as you tap out the notes with your stilts. This little dose of exercise is good enough for a whole week!

meaning_story: A fang on a turkey is elegant. Most turkeys do not have fangs, so this turkey with a fang is quite elegant and dignified. This turkey is special.
meaning_hint: Look at this turkey with a fang. It’s elegant, but also frightening. See the fanged turkey staring at you menacingly.
reading_story: You’re so scared of this elegant but menacing turkey with a fang that you start going “goo-goo ga-ga” (が) like a big baby. In between each goo and ga, you slowly back away from the turkey.
reading_hint: Say goo-goo ga-ga out loud a few times as you imagine backing away from the elegant and fearsome turkey. What a baby you are.

meaning_story: A teacher teaches you to respect your parents and elders with filial piety. Filial piety is a virtue of respect that's really important in Asian cultures like Japan. The first thing a teacher will teach their students is this!
meaning_hint: Imagine sitting down in class and the teacher is writing FILIAL PIETY in big letters on the white board.
reading_story: Now that you've been taught about filial piety, you should know how to address こういちfrom now on. He's your elder, after all. He might even be your dad, who knows. Make sure you use your new knowledge of filial piety to show your respect to こういち!
reading_hint: Being taught about filial piety has helped you see your elders, like こういち, in a whole new light!

meaning_story: You walk by a geoduck a frequent amount. This geoduck really intrigues you, so you can’t help but frequent the area the geoduck is in and walk around.
meaning_hint: Imagine walking around near this geoduck. This is the best area to frequent when you want to look at the geoduck. Just keep looking at it as you walk.
reading_story: Apparently Hindu people also love geoducks because Hindu (ひん) people frequent this area quite often as well. You always see the geoduck here, but also a lot of Hindu people.
reading_hint: Look at all the Hindu people as you walk around and observe the geoduck. Hear them all speaking Hindi as you continue to walk around.

meaning_story: A horse goes to his favorite district to gallop around. This district has lots of cool buildings and lights to look at, so this horse loves to gallop around there.
meaning_hint: Hear the horse clip clopping around the district as it continues to gallop. Clip clop, clop clip clop!
reading_story: Then the horse gallops into the road and gets hit by a car (か). Oh man, there’s blood everywhere. This horse is never going to gallop again. That car totally destroyed it.
reading_hint: The tires screech, the horse neighs, BAM! Total destruction everywhere. Bystanders scream in horror. That horse will never gallop again. It’s a sad day for all horsekind.

meaning_story: The leader of all the spiders is a genius! Spiders are already pretty smart. They can weave complex homes and traps in one web. They even know where not to step so they don't get caught. But the leader knows everything. It made itself a little webbed computer and everything!
meaning_hint: Imagine seeing the leader of the spiders weaving it's own little spider computer. Doing spider math, and spider chemistry. It's a genius!
reading_story: As you watch the spider genius you realize that soon (しゅん) spiders will take over the humans. They're just way smarter than us. Soon we'll be the bugs.
reading_hint: Soon we'll be slaves to the genius spiders. Soon we'll be the flies.

meaning_story: There’s grass on the ground and the fins there say you have no honor. The fins are left over from the fish you dismembered and they do not believe it was an act of honor. Now they are just sitting on the ground on the grass, calling you out for having no honor.
meaning_hint: Listen to what the fins have to say as they flop around on the ground in the grass. Hear them swish about as they flop, brushing up against the blades of grass.
reading_story: Being one of little honor, you decide to squash these vocal fins with your yo-yo (よ). You take out your yo-yo and start bashing each fin with it until they stop talking about what little honor you have.
reading_hint: Imagine taking your yo-yo out to do this. Feel the string tighten around your finger as you unleash the yo-yo and silence all the fins.

meaning_story: You take flowers down a slide to a drunkard that you picked from your luxuriant garden. You picked the flowers from the luxuriant garden, not the drunkard, mind you. Also the drunkard has a cane, but not flowers. That’s why you picked some from your luxuriant garden and slid down your cool slide.. Now the drunkard has a cane and some flowers.
meaning_hint: Imagine picking these flowers from your luxuriant garden then shooting down the slide. There are so many flowers that you are simply overwhelmed by their aroma. Now hand your flowers to the drunkard and watch his face light up as he excitedly thanks you for the gift.
reading_story: The drunkard is so happy to receive flowers from your luxuriant garden that he begins to moan (も) with pleasure. The moans are getting louder and more erotic. You’re kind of creeped out. You really want him to stop moaning.
reading_hint: Hear the drunkard moan as he rubs the flowers all over his body. You’re really weirded out. This is the last time you give him flowers from your luxuriant garden, that’s for sure.

meaning_story: Let’s take a flag and go together to IKEA, milord. Would that please you, milord? We can take the flag to IKEA and claim it for our country together.
meaning_hint: Imagine traveling together with your lord. Yes, milord. No, milord. Certainly, milord. Imagine carrying the flag with you as you travel to IKEA.
reading_story: Shall I dent (でん) the side of the IKEA building to place this flag, milord? Yes, milord. Right away, milord! I shall thrust the flag into the building, creating a dent for it to rest in, and claiming IKEA for our kingdom!
reading_hint: Imagine yourself thrusting the flag into the side of the IKEA building so hard that you make a dent. Feel the flag reverberate in your hands as the noise echoes in your ears.

meaning_story: A bad lion allows the pope and his family to multiply. The lion and the pope are both bad, actually. The bad lion keeps the pope’s enemies away so the pope is free to multiply his family and gain larger influence in the land.
meaning_hint: Imagine the pope as he multiplies. He actually reproduces asexually so just watch the pope split into multiple popes as the bad lion fends off those who would do him harm.
reading_story: You never expected the pope to multiply in such a way so this comes as quite a shock (しょく). And then you’ve got that bad lion too, and lions always provide a great shock. This whole situation is quite shocking, really.
reading_hint: Watch the pope continue to multiply in front of your eyes as you try to overcome the shock you are feeling. Since you’re in shock, you’re having trouble breathing and standing. You’ve got to get it together!

meaning_story: A butcher eats rice with protesters because they're his neighbors. The butcher may not be a protestor herself, but you always look out for your neighbors. And that means eating rice with them when they're hungry from protesting for so long.
meaning_hint: Picture all your protesting neighbors standing and eating rice while still trying to hold their signs up. Picture the butcher eating with them. The butcher brought the rice, you know!
reading_story: Suddenly the butcher's neighbors are ringing (りん) a bunch of bells. It's time to start protesting again, no time for eating! The butcher leaves her neighbors, the ringing bells still ringing in her ears. She's glad she isn't a protestor.
reading_hint: Imagine the ringing in your ears. You were just being a friendly neighbor. But now your ears are bothering you.

meaning_story: Every winter the thread fields become overgrown. Yes, thread grows in fields these days. And the thread grows the most in the winter because reasons. The thread gets so overgrown that you can’t even walk through it without cutting the thread down with a machete.
meaning_hint: Imagine trying to wade through this overgrown field of thread. It’s really difficult, and also it’s really cold because it’s winter. You shiver. Imagine chopping the thread down with your machete. Chop chop chop!
reading_story: The reason this field of thread got so overgrown is because you’re Han (はん) Solo and you’re not used to simple things like farming thread. Han Solo is used to blasting baddies and kissing princesses. Overgrown thread is not his specialty. Use your blaster to clear a way through this thread instead of using that machete.
reading_hint: Imagine yourself as Han Solo, bravely blasting your way through the overgrown thread with your blaster. Pew pew pew!

meaning_story: Passing by a water slide you shoot some arrows at it as you patrol the area. You patrol the perimeter of this waterpark and sometimes you shoot arrows at the water slide for target practice. It’s okay, no one uses that water slide, so no one is in danger.
meaning_hint: Imagine patrolling around this waterpark with your bow and arrows. Hear the bowstring draw tight as you fire multiple arrows at the water slide as you continue to patrol around.
reading_story: The only month you get to patrol this area is the month of June (じゅん). June is the only month that this park is open, so June is the only month you get to patrol around and shoot arrows at the water slide.
reading_hint: It’s June, so imagine how hot and sticky it is outside as you continue to fire arrows and patrol around the water slide. It’s toasty.

meaning_story: This tree is the master of a pillar. The pillar is subservient to its tree master because the tree is so great and awesome and big and cool and stuff. The pillar has great respect for its tree master.
meaning_hint: See the pillar next to the tree master. See the pillar bow over and over in veneration of its tree master.
reading_story: While bowing, the pillar accidently smashes Chewbacca (ちゅう). The pillar is horrified for having murdered Chewbacca, his tree master’s closest friend. The pillar is going to be punished.
reading_hint: Hear the crack and snap of branches as the tree beats the crap out of the pillar for having murdered Chewbacca. Unforgivable.

meaning_story: You take a nailbat and smack a turkey down the stairs into a portable carrier. You’ve been trying to get this turkey into the carrier so you could transport it for like, the past hour. You finally got it though, and all it took was hitting it down the stairs with your nailbat.
meaning_hint: Imagine hitting this turkey with your nailbat. Smack! Hear it gobble painfully as it tumbles down the stairs and crashes violently into the portable carrier at the bottom.
reading_story: The reason you need the turkey in the portable carrier is so that you can deliver him to the KKK (けい). They’re having a turkey dinner and you were in charge of providing the turkey. The KKK will be very happy you got their turkey.
reading_hint: Imagine delivering the turkey to the KKK in the portable carrier. They’re all wearing those white hoods so you don’t know which person to deliver the turkey to.

meaning_story: You use a lid to preserve your clothes and praise the Lord! Hallelujah! You put the lid over your clothes to preserve them. The top of your clothes had been cut off before, so you put them under the lid to preserve them so no further damage is done. Praise be to God!
meaning_hint: Praise whatever deity you choose to praise as you imagine yourself covering your cut off clothing. Keep in mind the top’s been cut off since the clothes radical in this kanji is missing the top half.
reading_story: When you lift up the lid, your clothes have disappeared! This sounds like one of Hou-dini’s (ほう) tricks. Hou-dini gives praise to demons and devils and they have bestowed Hou-dini with evil and corrupted power.
reading_hint: Hou-dini, you fiend! Give me my clothes back! Imagine chasing after this rascally Hou-dini as he attempts to abscond with your clothes.

meaning_story: You use the nailbat of injustice to reject perfectly good candidates attempting to join your Injustice League. Using the nailbat to reject those who would actually be good for your group, but since it’s the nailbat of injustice, you can’t really expect it to do anything good.
meaning_hint: Hit these applicants with the nailbat of injustice as you reject them one by one. Slap! Bop! Slam! Boop!
reading_story: Only one more person to reject so let us write a haiku (はい) to commemorate this occasion. You aren’t wanted here. Take your crap and go now please. This is injustice.
reading_hint: What a nice haiku we’ve composed. The guy you rejected likes the haiku so much that he doesn’t even mind that he was rejected.

meaning_story: A horse is your master and you are merely a resident in his house. How did this horse become your master? Those aren’t questions a resident should ask! Know your place, resident!
meaning_hint: Imagine having a horse as your master. Hear him neigh out orders to you and the other residents of the horse master’s house.
reading_story: To prove yourself a worthy resident of the horse master’s house, you must capture Chewbacca (ちゅう). Your horse master collects rare creatures, and Chewbacca is his latest desire. If you wish to remain a resident of the house, you must capture Chewbacca.
reading_hint: Imagine Chewbacca in a cage in the horse master’s house. You’ve proved yourself a worthy resident. Hear Chewbacca making his Wookie sounds as he bashes against the bars of his new cage.

meaning_story: You employ a geoduck to review your taxes. Geoducks are known for reviewing things well, so it makes sense to employ one when you have something to review.
meaning_hint: Look at this geoduck you employed flopping around on your tax forms as it reviews them. It’s kind of revolting. Slap, slap, flap, slap.
reading_story: You ask the geoduck to review your taxes and the geoduck asks for your first born 子 as payment. You don’t really like your 子 so you agree to trade your 子 for the geoduck’s reviewing services.
reading_hint: Hear your 子 as it is dragged away kicking and screaming by the geoduck. Are you a bad parent? Yes.

meaning_story: The cow of righteousness is always there for us. He is the cow that must sacrifice himself for us to survive. What righteousness this cow has!
meaning_hint: The reason he is sacrificing himself is so we can all eat! Yum! Thanks to your sacrifice, righteous cow, we all have hamburgers. Imagine the sacrifice of the actual cow being over the top and crazy though, considering cows get made into hamburgers every day. This cow is special though.
reading_story: One of the rites that happens while the people sacrifice the cow is someone plays the guitar (ぎ). The song the guitarist is playing is very inappropriate, so be sure to take notice of that.
reading_hint: Of course, the reading is also shared with kanji like 義. The righteousness radicals seems to have that effect on kanji.

meaning_story: You see an animal with some flowers and a turkey on a stool trying to seize them. The animal with the flowers is really tall so the turkey needs to stand on the stool in its attempt to seize the flowers.
meaning_hint: Look at this turkey straining itself on the stool trying to seize the flowers, grunting with effort. You think he’ll ever get them?
reading_story: The animal the turkey is trying to seize the flowers from is a cock (かく). The cock is a lot bigger than the turkey, so that’s why the turkey needs to stand on the stool in its attempt to seize those flowers.
reading_hint: Imagine this scene again only with a big cock holding the flowers as the turkey attempts to seize them. Hear the cock shouting cock-a-doodle-doo as it defends its flowers.

meaning_story: The guard guarding the gold has a really sharp sword. At least, he should if he wants to guard the gold well. If he has a dull sword, bad guys could just walk on by him.
meaning_hint: Picture how sharp the guard's sword is. It shines in the sunlight. It could cut anything, it's so sharp!
reading_story: You want to test how sharp it is, so you walk up and throw an ace (えい) card at him. In one, quick swipe, the ace is split in half! Woah! That sword is SUPER sharp!
reading_hint: Imagine how sharp a sword would have to be to cut an ace in half. Aces are the strongest card in the deck!

radicals: 十, 田, 方, 夂
meaning_story: Taking a cross, you walk through the rice paddy in the direction of winter and spread your arms wide. You spread your arms to halt the approach of winter because your rice paddy is not done growing yet. You take the cross with you for some extra religious power of persuasion.
meaning_hint: Imagine facing the direction of the approaching winter while facing away from the rice paddy. Feel the weight of the cross in your hands as you spread your arms and implore the winter to hold off on its arrival.
reading_story: You’re actually a Sheikh (しき) (an Arabic leader) which makes the fact that you’re holding a cross while you spread your arms even more of a big deal. You spread your arms wider than any Sheikh ever has before. Side note: The official kun'yomi reading is just し but since no vocab words ever use し, we're teaching you しき, which includes what used to be okurigana but is never used outside of the kanji anymore.
reading_hint: Feel the strain on your Sheikh arms as you continue to spread them. Since you’re a Sheikh, you have to set a good example for your people, so don’t let them (or your arms) down.

meaning_story: There is a water slide made from pine next to some stairs that are transparent. Since the stairs are transparent, they’re really hard to see so it almost looks like the water slide has no way to ascend it. Once you get closer though, you can see that there are actually stairs to get up there.
meaning_hint: Imagine ascending these transparent stairs. The water slide is up really high and being able to see through the stairs is making you really uncomfortable.
reading_story: Having conquered your near crippling vertigo, you make it to the top of the transparent staircase. This water slide is right in the middle of Tokyo (とう), so as you slide down, you get a great view of all the Tokyo sights.
reading_hint: You slide down the pine water slide and get some pine splinters in your butt. They really hurt, but you’re more focused on the amazing sights you’re seeing around Tokyo. It’s really beautiful.

meaning_story: A boob leaves a trident by a tree in a fit of abandon. Why would this boob abandon its weapon, a trident, by a tree? Why would it abandon the only thing that can protect it from harm? The boob runs away from the tree with tears in its eyes.
meaning_hint: Imagine the boob as it jiggles away from the trident it just abandoned. Hear the boob crying as it runs away.
reading_story: You realize that the boob had to abandon the trident for a reason. There’s a chest in the boob’s town that requires a key (き) to open. The boob could not obtain the key until it abandoned the way of the warrior. Now that the boob has abandoned his trident, the boob can take the key and open the mystery chest.
reading_hint: Imagine the boob using the key to open the chest. Hear the key click into the lock as the boob wiggles and jiggles in anticipation.

meaning_story: After unearthing a boob grave, you attain a boob. What else would be in the boob grave. Boob attained!
meaning_hint: Imagine attaining this boob from the boob grave. It is all gooey and squishy and you are happy to attain it.
reading_story: Actually you are Charlie Sheen (し) and you attain boobs from boob graves like this one on almost a weekly basis. Charlie Sheen just cannot get enough boobs. You love to attain boobs from boob graves.
reading_hint: Imagine being Charlie Sheen and attaining all these boobs from boob graves. You’re in boob heaven.

meaning_story: A nailbat takes time in the winter to reflect on the table it was based on. The creator of the nailbat had a table he really liked, so that’s what the nailbat’s design was based on. The nailbat’s creator died in the winter, so this is why the nailbat takes time each winter to reflect on his creator and the table he was based on. Winter is a tough time for the nailbat.
meaning_hint: Imagine the nailbat out in the winter cold, reflecting on the table he was based on. It’s really cold out and the wind and snow are blowing, but the nailbat cares not. Keep in mind that the winter is a bit altered, as this is a tumultuous time for the nailbat as he remembers his long dead creator.
reading_story: The table that the nailbat was based on was built in Little Kyoto (きょ). Both the nailbat and the table it was based on have designs specific to Little Kyoto. There is Japanese writing and koi fish designs on the both of them.
reading_hint: Imagine the nailbat again, but imagine it imagining the table it’s based on being built in Little Kyoto, hearing the electric saw, hammer, and sander as the creator works on the construction of the table.

meaning_story: The insect in winter that lands on a signpost is a bee. The bee is the insect that is on the signpost in the winter.
meaning_hint: See the bee on the signpost as you shiver from the winter cold. What is the bee doing out in the cold on this signpost? Perhaps he is lost.
reading_story: Not wanting to see the bee shivering in the winter cold anymore, you open up the hatch (はち) to your carrying case and shoo the bee inside. You shut the hatch, and transport the bee to a warmer area where you open the hatch and set the bee free.
reading_hint: Hear the bee buzzing furiously until you open the hatch. He doesn’t like to be contained, and the bee buzzes very happily once the hatch is opened again. Buzz buzz buzz!

meaning_story: The leader of righteousness is the only one who can run this ceremony. Why? Because it's a very pure ceremony, and only those with an extremely righteous mind can run it.
meaning_hint: Have him run your ceremony for you. Think about why he is so righteous, then think about an extremely righteous ceremony.
reading_story: Sadly, the reason only the righteous can run this ceremony is because it's a punishment ceremony, where he pulls the cord to cut someone's head off via a guillotine (ぎ).
reading_hint: *CHOP*

meaning_story: You climb up a mountain and a cliff in search of fire, but all you find is charcoal. You can make fire with the charcoal, but you were hoping to find fire itself. All that climbing for nothing.
meaning_hint: You’re angry that you could only find charcoal so you take the charcoal in your hands and you crush it atop the cliff on the mountain. Feel the charcoal breaking in your hands as the wind carries the charcoal dust off from the top of the cliff on the mountain.
reading_story: After crushing the charcoal, you decide to take advantage of your current location and lay out in the sun for a while to get a tan (たん). Instead of getting a tan though, you catch on fire. Oops.
reading_hint: Imagine lying out in the sun next to the crushed charcoal, thinking you’re going to get tan. You’re very surprised when you actually catch on fire. Hot hot hot!

meaning_story: The clothes radical and the clothes kanji are exactly the same! Surprising!
reading_story: An eagle (い) sees a pile of your clothes and lays an egg (え) in them. The eagle’s egg needs a soft warm place to incubate, and your pile of clothes are the perfect place.
reading_hint: Look at the eagle and her egg sitting atop your clothes. Every time you get close the eagle starts to screech at you fiercely. Screee! Screee!

kunyomi: くぐ, ひそ, もぐ
meaning_story: A tsunami carries a husband and his husband up into the sun where they conceal their centaur. The two husbands run a centaur farm, but the local government isn’t too pleased by this so they have to conceal their centaurs in the sun unless they want them to be confiscated by the government.
meaning_hint: Imagine the tsunami carrying the husbands and the centaur up into the sun. Hear the water gushing as they conceal the centaur up there. That tsunami is gigantic.
reading_story: What is it the husbands are going to conceal? Oh that’s right, a centaur (せん). They are concealing a centaur in the sun. How forgetful of you.
reading_hint: Just make sure to remember there is a centaur up on that tsunami with the husbands. They need to conceal the centaur to keep it safe.

meaning_story: The leader gets a nice uniform for the sake of not wanting to look like a fake. The leader is a fake, he just doesn’t want to look like one. He’s not really a leader, but he thinks he should get an official looking uniform for the sake of not looking like a fake.
meaning_hint: Look at this fake leader. See him scramble into a uniform. Does he look like a real leader? Or can you tell that he is a fake?
reading_story: In another attempt to distract you from realizing he is a fake, the fake leader starts playing guitar (ぎ). The music is lovely and haunting. The guitar music is starting to influence your thinking.
reading_hint: Wow. This guitar music is so good. Just listen to the beautiful melody. What was that about a fake leader? I dunno, but this music rocks.

meaning_story: A fire in the rice paddy burns down the field. The rice paddy fire spreads out from the paddy and consumes the field next to it. This rice paddy fire has ravaged your entire farm!
meaning_hint: Look at this fire burning the rice paddy and the surrounding field. Smell burnt rice in the air as you see the flames dance before your eyes.
reading_story: Your rice paddy farm and field are on a cay. A cay is a small, sandy island, and since your farm in on fire, this cay has turned into a hot cay. Or as Mario would say, that’s one-a hot-a cay! (はたけ) Mama mia!
reading_hint: Imagine running around this hot cay as you try to put out the fire in your field. The fire is ravaging the entire hot cay, so it takes you a while to put it out. Man those flames are hot. Also, this kanji can have the reading はた for the kun'yomi as well. If you learn the longer version (はたけ) it will be easier to just shave off a kana to remember the shorter version.

meaning_story: A Viking insect is a firefly. In the insect kingdom, the insect most resembling a Viking is undoubtedly the firefly.
meaning_hint: Imagine this little firefly blinking his firefly light as he flies around shouting a Viking warcry and brandishing an axe. Yaaaargh!
reading_story: The Viking firefly is attacking Hotaru (ほたる) Tomoe (alter ego of Sailor Saturn) because the Viking firefly hates the show Sailor Moon and everyone on it. Hotaru screams in terror as she is deathly afraid of fireflies, especially Viking ones.
reading_hint: Hear Hotaru’s shrill scream as she runs away from the Viking firefly. If you don’t know what Hotaru Tomoe looks like, Google a picture of her to get a better visualization.

meaning_story: Horns rise out of a train as it forces your hand into a fist with its demonic powers. This train is possessed by evil which is why it has horns. It uses its demon powers to shape your hand into a fist and then proceeds to command your body to punch yourself in the face with your fist.
meaning_hint: Make a fist with your hand. Now imagine being compelled by a train with horns to strike yourself in the face with your very own fist. How embarrassing.
reading_story: You cry out for help, so Ken (けん) from Street Fighter and his mighty fist arrive on the scene. Ken takes his manly fist and punches the evil train with horns to pieces. You’re saved!
reading_hint: Look at Ken punch this huge train with his fist. BAM! You feel your hand unclench from a fist once the train is defeated. Free at last!

meaning_story: There is some runny poop raining down on the good butcher in his hometown. The good butcher’s hometown is actually not very fond of him, so whenever he is back in his hometown, they pour runny poop on him.
meaning_hint: Imagine being this good butcher and going back to your hometown only to be greeted by a bucket of runny poop pouring down on your head. It’s wet, hot, steamy, and smelly. Keep in mind how runny this poop is since the radical is a bit runny itself.
reading_story: Your hometown is Kyoto (きょう). Whenever you go back to your hometown of Kyoto, they pour this runny poop on you.
reading_hint: Imagine being in your hometown of Kyoto and getting this runny poop poured on you. Imagine looking at the sights in Kyoto as you wipe the runny poop out of your eyes.

meaning_story: Wearing this helmet, I am certain that that insect produces honey. Yes, my helmet is telling me that insect is a bee, a producer of honey. Of this I am certain.
meaning_hint: This helmet gives you super intelligence. You are certain about pretty much everything. Now taste this honey you are certain comes from that bee insect. It is sticky and sweet. Mmm, honey.
reading_story: To gather the honey, you use honey gathering mitts (みつ), of which you are certain are magical. These mitts are super awesome at collecting honey. Together with that helmet you are wearing, these mitts make you look fabulous.
reading_hint: Feel these mitts on your hands as you eat more honey. Your hands are hot and sweaty inside the mitts, but you care not! This honey is too good.

meaning_story: This leader has two things that remind him of his humanity: his shoes, and his hat. These two things remind the leader of his humanity because humans are the only ones who wear shoes and hats.
meaning_hint: Reflect upon your own humanity. What does it mean to be human? Is it wearing shoes and hats? Probably.
reading_story: Another thing that reminds you and the leader about your humanity is wearing jeans (じん). Jeans are the go-to legwear for many people, and no one but humans wear them. Jeans are another great symbol of humanity.
reading_hint: Are you wearing jeans right now? If so, rub them with your hands and say aloud “Oh, the humanity!” Or just imagine wearing jeans if you aren’t actually wearing them.

meaning_story: Going down a water slide is a child contemplating his lineage to show that he is humble. All the other children going down the slide come from a wealthy and royal lineage, but this child wants to be humble by proving that his lineage is nothing special.
meaning_hint: Imagine this child zooming down the water slide thinking about his lineage. Look how humble this child is. So humble.
reading_story: Actually, this humble child is your son (そん). You’re so proud of him. Mostly because you are humble too, you can't brag to everyone about how humble your son is because that would be decidedly unhumble.
reading_hint: Imagine in your mind what you think about your humble son as you watch him ride down the slide. Think “My son is humble! So humble! That’s my son!”

meaning_story: There is a tiny leader on Wolverine’s forehead sitting on a stool and commanding his troops to invade Wolverine’s brain. These tiny soldiers are going to invade Wolverine’s body in an attempt to destroy him. The leader himself isn’t going to invade Wolverine’s brain, he’s just going to sit on the stool and supervise.
meaning_hint: Imagine the little leader sitting on Wolverine’s forehead as he shouts “Invade! Invade invade! Invade his brain and destroy the Wolverine!”
reading_story: Soon they realize that they cannot invade Wolverine through his head so they travel down to his leg and try to enter through his shin (しん). The little soldiers take a big knife and slice open Wolverine’s shin in order to invade his body.
reading_hint: See the little soldiers slicing open Wolverine’s shin as Wolverine grunts in pain. Getting your leg cut open is not a comfortable thing, even for someone as manly as Wolverine.

meaning_story: Gold is not a wide spread mineral. Comparatively, gold is a rare mineral. You do not find it widely spread everywhere.
meaning_hint: Take a piece of this precious mineral in your hand. Look at this gold and its golden shine as you turn the mineral over in your hands.
reading_story: Now imagine our good pal こういち mining for this mineral. こういち is really greedy so he needs to get his hands on precious minerals like gold.
reading_hint: See こういち in his hard hat and overalls. He’s not wearing a shirt, but that’s because he is こういち and he is very confident in his physique. Watch him break the ground with his pickaxe as he searches for minerals. Sexy.

meaning_story: Your leader is also a director so you need to pay respects to him before you can start filming. He’s a huge big-shot and you don’t want to offend him by not paying the proper respects, so you make sure to bow every time you go on stage.
meaning_hint: Imagine bowing really really low as you walk on set. Don’t look him in the eye! He might get upset. Just do as you’re told!
reading_story: The name of the director is Ook Aga (うかが). Ook Aga is a caveman which is why everyone has to be really careful and make sure they pay respects to him. Ook Aga doesn’t know how to live in a civilized society so your phones and clothes scare him. You have to bow really low and respect what he says, moving slowly, so that he continues to direct you and won’t run away or hurt anyone.
reading_hint: Imagine Ook Aga looking down on you and you bow, slowly walking onto the stage. Oh no, your cell phone is ringing. He’s grunting Ook Aga Ook Aga and looking around angrily. Quick, put it away and pay your respects harder!! Bow, BOW!

meaning_story: You loiter around to see the boob moon that only comes out in the winter. It's like a full moon, except it looks like a boob in the sky and it only happens once in the winter season. As you're staring up at it, all of a sudden something flies into it, so hard that it penetrates the surface and disappears inside.
meaning_hint: You're not sure if you saw what you think you saw, as it only happened in a second. Think about whether or not you actually saw it.
reading_story: The thing that penetrated the boob moon was Tetsuo (てつ), the Iron Man, which is a wacky Japanese movie. Or, you can think about how a 鉄 man ran into the moon, penetrating the surface.
reading_hint: Unbelievably, you can see this with your naked eye.

meaning_story: A tsunami crashes into an ent and a geoduck, knocking them into some rapids whereupon they get washed into the shallows. Being scared for their lives, the ent and geoduck flail around the entire time.
meaning_hint: Look at the ent and the geoduck flailing around in terror as they get washed through the raging rapids and into the shallows. Hear them splashing about as they scream and yell for help.
reading_story: After being washed through the rapids and into the shallows the ent and the geoduck are both screaming “Save (せ) me! Save me!” They need to be saved from the water, and you are the only one who can save them. You gotta run over and help them out.
reading_hint: Imagine saving the ent and the geoduck as they continue to shout “Save me! Save me!” into your ear as you carry them to safety.

meaning_story: Surrounding the grave of a tiger is a cactus and some ruins. The tiger was the hero of the desert, which is why they made a nice grave for him here next to a cactus and the ruins that used to be his kingdom. This tiger used to have a whole kingdom all to himself. But now it is just ruins.
meaning_hint: Imagine looking at these ruins around the tiger’s grave. Most of the ruins are tiger themed with tiger busts and carvings everywhere. Just look at them all!
reading_story: Actually, these ruins are really in a remote place of Little Kyoto (きょ). I bet you didn’t know that Little Kyoto had a desert with ruins in it. Well, now you know. Little Kyoto has a little desert filled with ruins that were once the kingdom of a tiger.
reading_hint: Imagine standing in these ruins in Little Kyoto. You can hear the hustle and bustle of the city behind you as you observe the tiger’s grave.

meaning_story: The alcohol you take a measurement most carefully of is sake. Sake is very important to the alcohol culture in Japan, so you must make sure to measure it out to the precise amount.
meaning_hint: Imagine this sake as you measure it out. Hear it pouring out of the bottle as you catch the whiff of sweet alcohol in the air.
reading_story: You know who enjoyed sake a lot? Chewbacca (ちゅう). He was always drinking, which is concerning when you think about all the driving he did.
reading_hint: Imagine Chewbacca drinking sake all the time while Han Solo told him he needed to stop and get help, but Chewbacca just did his yell thing and drank more sake.

meaning_story: A nailbat from long ago. You remember this nailbat. It is a nailbat which you set aside for this very purpose! It's dusty and old and from long ago, but you knew this day would come. You pick up the nailbat and go outside.
meaning_hint: You can imagine what's outside waiting for you (that would require setting aside a nailbat), but the important thing is you feel the relief from finding the nailbat that your past self put there. What a good thinker you were. You set it aside for yourself in the future, knowing this day would come!
reading_story: But, you're also disappointed. The nailbat you set aside was a pretty so-so (jそ) nailbat. Not even the highest quality. Sure, you didn't have as much money back then, but if you saw this was going to happen in the future, wouldn't you want to go all out?
reading_hint: So, feel a little disappointed by the so-so quality, but it should still work, hopefully.

meaning_story: Something you say to someone you become attached to should be said with sincerity. You need to speak with sincerity when you say things to someone who will eventually become your significant other, for example.
meaning_hint: Imagine saying something with sincerity to someone who will become your significant other. Say something like “I love you” out loud. Say it with the utmost sincerity.
reading_story: Do you know what else you can SEI (せい) SEI SEI with sincerity? You can say that Hard Gay would sincerely enjoy that pun we’ve just made. Haha! So funny we are. SEI SEI SEI!!
reading_hint: Look at Hard Gay complimenting us for our clever pun involving his catchphrase. See him pelvic thrusting violently in the air as he shouts, “Thanks! SEI SEI SEI! Thanks!” Also keep in mind that this kanji shares its reading with 成.

meaning_story: A tiger has legs that belong to a tiger. You know, a tiger has the legs of a tiger. This is common knowledge. Nothing new here.
meaning_hint: Look at the tiger running with his tiger legs. So majestic. So fierce.
reading_story: The tiger is using his legs to run away from the Torah (とら). This tiger is deathly afraid of religion, so a holy book like the Torah causes the tiger to run away.
reading_hint: Imagine watching the tiger as it notices the Torah and then runs away. The tiger sounds as if it is screaming in terror as it flees from the proximity of the Torah.

meaning_story: You hand a sail to someone to oversee for your warship. You're too busy to bother with overseeing your own warship sail, so that's why you delegate the overseeing to someone else.
meaning_hint: Imagine being on this majestic warship. It’s grand. And you can really enjoy it because there is someone else overseeing your sail for you so you are free to just bask in the sea breeze and sunshine.
reading_story: As your warship starts to pick up speed from the sail your dude was overseeing, a can (かん) hits your warship. The can is just a can, so it does little damage, but it’s still annoying.
reading_hint: Hear the can tink as it hits the side of your warship. Tink! Silly can, you cannot harm this warship!

meaning_story: A nailbat hits a boob moon in winter due to withdrawal. The nailbat had gotten used to drinking milk from the great boob moon come winter, but lately it’s been weaned from this milk and is in withdrawal. Therefore, the nailbat lashes out in anger.
meaning_hint: Imagine this nailbat hitting a moon shaped like a boob. It makes a sickening smack, but the ensuing wiggles are quite mesmerizing.
reading_story: This withdrawal becomes so severe that the nailbat transforms into Tetsuo (てつ) the Iron Man. Tetsuo doesn’t deal well with withdrawal, so Tetsuo smashes open the boob moon and drinks all the remaining milk inside.
reading_hint: Imagine Tetsuo the Iron Man raging so hard that the boob moon explodes. Hear the booming sound of the boob moon exploding and watch as Tetsuo slops down the remaining boob moon juice.

radicals: 十, 木, 寸, 豆
meaning_story: A tree is carved into a cross which is used to eat beans and can also be used to measure the wood content of other objects. This tree that got turned into a cross is very useful. The reason it can determine the wood content of other objects is because it is made out of wood itself. Also, you can eat beans with it. Yum.
meaning_hint: This cross is made of wood so as you eat the beans you get some splinters in your mouth. It really hurts. At least the beans are good.
reading_story: You used your wood cross way too much for eating beans and not so much on measuring wood, so your mouth is dry and full of nasty splinters. You need something to ease the pain and quench your post-bean thirst. You look around and see a small juice (じゅ) box sitting on your counter. You don't know how it got there, and it's super small, but at least this will help you get these beans and splinters down.
reading_hint: You're drinking a small juice box to ease the pain of using a wood cross to eat beans. Too bad the juice is just making the cuts in your mouth sting, and it's too small to help you swallow all the beans. It was worth a shot at least, right?

meaning_story: Inside an enclosure is a cobra that will wrap itself around anything if given the chance. If you let the cobra out of the enclosure, it will wrap itself around you!
meaning_hint: Hear the cobra hiss as it comes out of the enclosure and starts to wrap itself around your arm. Feel the scales running over your skin as it continues to wrap up your arm.
reading_story: Luckily for you, you are Hou-dini (ほう) and no wrap can hold you, not even the wrap of a cobra! Magically, you, the great Hou-dini, escapes from being wrapped up by the cobra. Ta~da!
reading_hint: You are Hou-dini. Imagine escaping from the wrap of the cobra only to be greeted by a large round of applause. Good job.

meaning_story: You hit a tree with an axe so you can do some analysis on it. To do the analysis on the tree, a cross section needs to be obtained, so you must chop it in half with your axe.
meaning_hint: Imagine taking this axe in your hands and chopping away at this tree to do your analysis. Hear the chop chop chop as wood chips fly into your face.
reading_story: The person who is doing this analysis is very sexy (せき). Who is this sexy person? Why it’s you of course, you sexy beast. I love watching you do analysis on trees. It’s so sexy.
reading_hint: Imagine yourself being sexy and doing tree analysis. What sort of sexy analysis moves can you think of? Oh yeah, so sexy.

meaning_story: Onto a spring you toss a melon and it flies in an arc. The melon lands on the spring and the spring shoots the melon off in an arc. This spring is like a melon launcher.
meaning_hint: Look at the melon flying away from the spring in an arc. Hear it whistling through the air until it finally crashes to the ground with a resounding SPLOOSH!
reading_story: You are a little 子 and this melon launching in an arc is your only form of entertainment. Your family works on a little melon farm and doesn’t have much money for 子 toys. You do really like watching the melon fly in an arc though.
reading_hint: Imagine being a 子 while you watch the melon fly in an arc. Imagine a little 子 version of yourself giggling and clapping your hands with absolute glee.

meaning_story: In a boob grave are a set of ribs waiting for the arrival of the boobs. The boob grave has ribs in it, but the boobs that are supposed to go in the boob grave have not arrived yet, so the ribs are just waiting for their arrival.
meaning_hint: Imagine these ribs waiting in anticipation for the arrival of the boobs. Imagine the ribs with little hands grabbing at the air in anticipation.
reading_story: The reason the arrival of these boobs is delayed is because they are flying all the way from Tokyo (とう). When these boobs died, they were in Tokyo, but the boob grave for these boobs is on the other side of the world.
reading_hint: Imagine the boobs flying in an airplane from Tokyo to the boob grave. How weird would it be to see boobs riding on a plane like this?

meaning_story: For a car, the reason why it works is because it has an axis that it is built on. If it doesn't have that, it won't work at all.
meaning_hint: Imagine a car without an axis on it. Not a car that will work too well.
reading_story: You see a car without an axis and it's your friend's car. He's all like 'isn't this a cool car?' You reply: 'Gee, cool' (じく) very sarcastically.
reading_hint: You're super sarcastic about this, so feel the sarcasm inside of you when you imagine this.

meaning_story: If you take a thread and wrap up a bunch of it, so much it becomes a hill of thread, you're going to have a lot of thread. You can wrap some of that thread around other thread to create a much thicker thread. This thread is a cable.
meaning_hint: Imagine yourself twisting this hill of thread up to make thicker cables. They're strong!
reading_story: You use this cable to swing down from a building but you need to do it soon (つな)! You're being chased by some bad guys and they've almost caught you, so if you're gonna swing to safety with this cable, you need to do it soon.
reading_hint: Gotta do it soon. Imagine swinging from this cable and feeling the wind in your hair.

meaning_story: A nailbat is a bad omen that you will soon encounter a challenge. The nailbat represents challenge. Why else would you need a nailbat? Therefore the sight of a nailbat is an omen of an approaching challenge.
meaning_hint: Pick up the nailbat and heft its weight in your hands. Think of what challenge could be approaching that you would need to use this nailbat.
reading_story: The challenge you are facing comes in the form of Evil Mrs. Chou (ちょう). Mrs. Chou has issued a challenge to you. She wants to fight you in a duel. The nailbat was sent to you by her in order to issue the challenge. It was a bad omen after all.
reading_hint: Imagine fighting Mrs. Chou with this nailbat. She is a tough challenge. Your arms are weak and weary from swinging this nailbat around during the battle with Mrs. Chou.

meaning_story: Not to be confused with the Zerg homeworld... you take a turkey and a fish tail and put them in the oven. This is your dinner tonight. Unfortunately, you forget that they're in there and they get horribly charred.
meaning_hint: Imagine the fish/turkey smell from the charred fish and turkey. What is that, you think... Oh no! That's my fish tail and turkey, now they'll taste terrible.
reading_story: What's worse is that you were cooking this meal for the Shogun (しょう) who is coming over for dinner. What an embarassment. Now all you have is easymac.
reading_hint: The Shogun comes over and you have to explain. Feel the embarassment. Feel the fear (that he will take your head for this).

meaning_story: You have a nailbat and a flag but no exit so you must dig your way out. You’re in a room with a dirt floor, so you use the nailbat to dig your way out so you can exit the building.
meaning_hint: Imagine using this nailbat to dig your way an exit. Feel your arms tire as you dig and dig and dig, dirt flying everywhere.
reading_story: You dig until you finally reach an exit. Upon your exit, you see a bunch of old coots (くつ). They’re all moaning and groaning like old coots do, you know the type. Since they just saw you digging, the old coots all decide to dig as well. You exit the area as the old coots just start to dig in the ground to no apparent reason.
reading_hint: Imagine walking out of this situation carrying your nailbat and flag as all the old coots dig around you while they moan and groan. How strange.

meaning_story: Take this thread and look at this part. Now look at this part! Now look at this part. You don't know where to look! Haha, I have distracted you!
meaning_hint: You don't know what part of the thread to look at. What a distraction.
reading_story: Despite how distracted you are, that was indeed a lot of fun (ふん).
reading_hint: Imagine yourself really enjoying looking at parts of the thread. You don't know why it's so fun, but being derpy is exciting, I guess.

meaning_story: This bamboo can be whittled into an example of anything. See, here's a car. Here's a snake. I can make so many examples just with bamboo.
meaning_hint: It's amazing how fast this guy can whittle!
reading_story: One last example for you. Now I'm going to take this bamboo and whittle it into an example of Han (はん) Solo!
reading_hint: Han Solo's bamboo example comes to life and runs off.

meaning_story: You take a nailbat to your tongue to fasten it to the bat. By hitting your tongue with the nailbat, your tongue becomes fastened to the nails on the bat. What else do you think would happen?
meaning_hint: Imagine your tongue being fastened to the nailbat. There is a nail from the nailbat sticking into your tongue. It really hurts a lot.
reading_story: You actually did not mean to fasten your tongue to this nailbat so you enlist the help of two cats (かつ) to unfasten your tongue. However, in their attempt to help, both of the cats fasten their tongues to the nailbat as well.
reading_hint: How did they manage to fasten their tongues to the nailbat as well? They’re cats. Listen to them meow and hiss as they struggle to get free.

meaning_story: The mullet of a tree is on the floor. The tree finally decided to clean up his look, so he cut his mullet. Now the tree’s mullet is on the floor.
meaning_hint: Look at the floor where the tree’s mullet lies as you hear the tree crying over what he’d just done. The tree already misses his mullet.
reading_story: The reason this tree’s mullet is now on the floor is because the tree wants to be employed by the shogun (しょう). The shogun despises mullets, so the tree had to cut his hair first before he could work for the shogun.
reading_hint: Imagine the tree kneeling on the floor next to his fallen mullet as he implores the shogun to finally hire him on. Hear the shogun going “Hmm… Hmmmmm…” as he evaluates this potential employee.

meaning_story: There's a nailbat at the shop that you want to buy. This nailbat is perfect. It fits your grip so nicely.
meaning_hint: Grab the nailbat and feel it in your grip. It's like it was made for your hand.
reading_story: You get a grip on the nailbat. You don't use this to hurt people, you use it for acupuncture (あく). How does that feel?
reading_hint: Imagine yourself using the nailbat in your acupuncture firm. Sure, it's out of the ordinary, but it is very effective somehow.

meaning_story: In the tree district of town you can buy a lot of tree products, including doors. With those doors, though, you always need hinges.
meaning_hint: Don't forget to buy a hinge. Your door purchase will hinge on your hinges.
reading_story: You buy an awesome hinge and try it out. Instead of working properly, it just falls apart and the door falls on you, crushing your lower body. You yell out (and you have to yell) 'I'm GOING TO SUUUUEEE (すう) YOU!'
reading_hint: Really lengthen out that 'sue' because it's a long 'suu' for the reading and that will help.

meaning_story: A nailbat combats gravity as you hoist it up in the air. When you hoist this nailbat, you feel the pull of gravity against it.
